description: A variant of the Science Data Processing flagging code, wrapped in dask, operating on Measurement Sets

parameters.name: config
parameters.info: YAML config file containing parameters for the flagger in the 'sum_threshold' key.

parameters.name: flagging-strategy
parameters.info: Flagging Strategy. If 'standard' all correlations in the visibility are flagged independently. If 'polarisation' the polarised intensity sqrt(Q^2 + U^2 + V^2) is calculated and used to flag all correlations in the visibility

parameters.name: row-chunks
parameters.info: Hint indicating the number of Measurement Set rows to read in a single chunk. Smaller and larger numbers will tend to respectively decrease or increase both memory usage and computational efficiency

parameters.name: baseline-chunks
parameters.info: Number of baselines in a window chunk

parameters.name: nworkers
parameters.info: Number of workers (threads) to use. By default, set to twice the number of logical CPUs on the system. Many workers can also affect memory usage on systems with many cores.

parameters.name: dilate-masks
parameters.info: Number of channels to dilate as int or string with units

parameters.name: data-column
parameters.info: Name of visibility data column to flag

parameters.name: subtract-model-column
parameters.info: Columns to subtract from 'data-column' to form residuals to flag on

parameters.name: field-names
parameters.info: Name(s) of fields to flag. Defaults to flagging all

parameters.name: -dpm, --disable-post-mortem
parameters.info: Disable the default behaviour of starting the Interactive Python Debugger upon an unhandled exception. This may be necessary for batch pipelining

parameters.name: window-backend
parameters.info: Visibility and flag data is re-ordered from a MS row ordering into time-frequency windows ordered by baseline. For smaller problems, it may be possible to pack a couple of scans worth of visibility data  into memory, but for larger problem sizes, it is necessary to reorder the data on disk
